p:
Several approaches are being taken to prevent and reduce hazardous drinking in New Zealand, including strengthening regulation through the Sale and Supply of Alcohol Act 2012 ( table 4). This Act introduced a limit on alcohol vending hours, strengthened restrictions around irresponsible promotion of alcohol, and stricter laws on the supply of alcohol. It also increased the ability of communities to control alcohol licensing in their local area, run national social marketing campaigns to raise awareness about alcohol harms, expand school-based health services to improve early identification and treatment referrals for young people with an alcohol problem, provide self-help tools such as the Alcohol Drug Helpline, and support people to address their alcohol issues through primary care and specialist services.
